title: Eliza (horse)
text:
Eliza (foaled 1990 in <a href="Kentucky">Kentucky</a>) is an American <a href="Thoroughbred">Thoroughbred</a> <a href="Eclipse%20Award">Champion</a> <a href="horse%20racing">racehorse</a>.
Background.
A descendant of the great <a href="Nearco">Nearco</a> through both her sire and her dam, Eliza was sired by multiple stakes winner, Mt. Livermore, a son of the outstanding sire, <a href="Blushing%20Groom">Blushing Groom</a>. Her dam was owner <a href="Allen%20E.%20Paulson">Allen Paulson's</a> Daring Bidder, a daughter of the 1966 <a href="American%20Champion%20Older%20Male%20Horse">American Co-Champion Older Male Horse</a>, <a href="Bold%20Bidder">Bold Bidder</a>. In his 2003 book, "Legacies of the Turf", noted race historian <a href="Edward%20L.%20Bowen">Edward L. Bowen</a> wrote that according to Paulson family banter, Madeleine Paulson traded <a href="Cigar%20%28horse%29">Cigar</a> to husband Allen for Eliza.
Racing career.
Racing in Allen Paulson's name, Eliza was trained in 1992 by the then thirty-year-old <a href="Alex%20L.%20Hassinger%2C%20Jr.">Alex Hassinger Jr.</a>, who had just obtained his training license. At age two, the filly made five starts. She finished second in the <a href="Sorrento%20Stakes">Sorrento Stakes</a> and won the <a href="Arlington-Washington%20Lassie%20Stakes">Arlington-Washington Lassie</a> and <a href="Alcibiades%20Stakes">Alcibiades Stakes</a> en route to the most important win of her career, the <a href="Breeders%27%20Cup%20Juvenile%20Fillies">Breeders' Cup Juvenile Fillies</a>. Raced that year at <a href="Florida">Florida's</a> <a href="Gulfstream%20Park">Gulfstream Park</a>, Eliza set a new stakes record time. Her 1992 performances earned her <a href="American%20Champion%20Two-Year-Old%20Filly">American Champion Two-Year-Old Filly</a> honors.
At age three, Eliza made four starts. She won the Grade I <a href="Santa%20Anita%20Oaks">Santa Anita Oaks</a>, ran second to <a href="Dispute%20%28horse%29">Dispute</a> in the Grade I <a href="Kentucky%20Oaks">Kentucky Oaks</a>, and was third against <a href="Colt%20%28horse%29">colt</a>s in the Grade I <a href="Santa%20Anita%20Derby">Santa Anita Derby</a>. She made four more starts at age four in 1994, her best result a third in the June Darling Handicap at <a href="Del%20Mar%20Racetrack">Del Mar Racetrack</a>.
Breeding record.
Retired to <a href="broodmare">broodmare</a> duty, Eliza was bred to Allen Paulson's <a href="Theatrical%20%28horse%29">Theatrical</a> plus important stallions such as <a href="Storm%20Bird">Storm Bird</a>, <a href="A.P.%20Indy">A.P. Indy</a> and <a href="Fusaichi%20Pegasus">Fusaichi Pegasus</a>. The most successful of her foals in racing was Mr. Kent who won four races in <a href="Japan">Japan</a> and earned the equivalent of <a href="United%20States%20dollar">US$</a>728,607.
